etymologies: late Middle English: from clear+ storey

definitions: the upper part of the nave, choir, and transepts of a large church, containing a series of windows. It is clear of the roofs of the aisles and admits light to the central parts of the building.
shortDefinitions: upper part of nave, choir, and transepts of large church

definitions: the windows in the clerestory of a church or similar windows in another building.
shortDefinitions: series of similar windows in another large building

definitions: a raised section of roof running down the center of a railroad car, with small windows or ventilators.
shortDefinitions: raised section of roof running down centre of railway carriage
